arts.ttl: Government buys back Mallorca estates from Kuwait
arts.sum: The Balearic Government has paid 3.4 million euros to buy the Son Jaumell, Cala Torta, and Es Pins Campaners estates in Mallorca's Llevant region from a company whose sole administrator is Fawziah Al Hassawi, a relative of the Emir of Kuwait . Mubarak Abdul Azif Al Hassawi began investing in Mallorca in the 1960s at the height of the tourism boom and the development that came to be referred to as the 'Balearization' process.

arts.ttl: Abandoned since 2008, a Mallorca bullring has new owners
arts.sum: It was in fact an historical stipulation for at least one bullfight to be staged each year - for the Sant Agust√≠ Fiestas on August 28 - that prevented a sale going ahead. There is no obligation to do so, and the town hall indicated last year that there was purchase interest so long as the stipulation for the fiestas' bullfight was scrapped.

arts.ttl: Reaching for higher stars: The modernisation of Mallorca's hotels
arts.sum: In 2023, the last year for which there are complete figures from the AETIB tourism strategy agency, there were 452 four and five-star hotels in Mallorca. The Exceltur report notes only a 5.2% increase in the number of places over the past decade.

arts.ttl: Mallorca beach again covered by thousands of 'little sails'
arts.sum: On Saturday, the Repic beach in Puerto Soller was covered by thousands upon thousands of ' velella velella ', a jellyfish-like hydrozoa species known in English, among other names, as 'little sail'. They are from the same family as the Portuguese man o' war, and so aren't strictly speaking jellyfish.

Valencia are on an impressive run in La Liga of late, losing just once in their previous seven games. Their recent form has seen them climb out of the relegation zone, but they are just one point abov...
Gili notes that the first week of April is expected to be warm, with temperatures above the seasonal average. Looking ahead to the week of 14th to 20th April, weather changes are anticipated.
